summary: Lance W Svendsen was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail his position and salary within the committee. The consistent appearance of his name across these payroll documents indicates his sustained employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Lance W Svendsen's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations.
